title: ‘Pam & Tommy’ Review: A Grown-Up Tale of Adult Entertainment
sub_head: The Hulu series about the notorious ’90s Pamela Anderson and Tommy Lee video offers more than just lewd celebrity schadenfreude.
body:
As moms always used to say, never leave the house without wearing clean underwear. (“What if you got in an accident?”) Today’s savvier mothers will include, “Don’t put anything in a text that you wouldn’t want on a billboard.” And those who followed the saga of Pamela Anderson and Tommy Lee circa 1997 might add, “Don’t have sex on camera if you don’t want it on the internet.”
The notorious mid-’90s sex tape that featured newlyweds Anderson and Lee—and kick-started the porn industry as it now exists on the web—might seem like the trashiest pretense imaginable for an eight-part miniseries. But to say that “Pam & Tommy” transcends its source material wouldn’t be giving it close to enough credit. It’s hard to think of an instance when a more talented group of actors—notably Lily James as the onetime “Baywatch” star and Sebastian Stan as her rock-star husband—portrayed such a morally dubious cast of characters. And made them, in the end, sympathetic.
